IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE AMERICA'S MOST IMPORTANT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE AMERICA'S MOST IMPORTANT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES. THE CONSERVANCY IDENTIFIES IMPORTANT ENDANGERED SITES, ACQUIRES THE PROPERTY BY PURCHASE, GIFT, OR BARGAIN SALE FROM DONORS, SECURES THE PROPERTY, STABILIZES THE CULTURAL RESOURCES AT THE SITE, MANAGES THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL PRESERVE AS PART OF A LONG-TERM PLAN, AND EDUCATES THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND LOCAL OFFICIALS ABOUT THE DESTRUCTION OF OUR CULTURAL HERITAGE AND HOW TO PRESERVE WHAT REMAINS.
IRS990.Desc: ACQUISITION, CONSERVATION, AND MANAGEMENT: DURING THE YEAR ENDED JULY 31, 2023, THE CONSERVANCY COMPLETED THE ACQUISITION OF 17 ENDANGERED ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES WHICH ARE NOW MANAGED AS ARCHAEOLOGICAL PRESERVES. EIGHTEEN MORE SITES AND CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ARE IN VARIOUS STAGES OF ACQUISITION. IN ALL, THE CONSERVANCY HAS PRESERVED OVER 567 ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY, MAINTAINING SECURITY AND PROVIDING STABILIZATION AND OTHER MAINTENANCE SERVICES ON THE PRESERVES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION: DURING THE YEAR ENDED JULY 31, 2023, THE CONSERVANCY PUBLISHED FOUR ISSUES OF "AMERICAN ARCHAEOLOGY" MAGAZINE, WHICH WERE DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES WITH A TOTAL DISTRIBUTION OF APPROXIMATELY 25,000 COPIES PER ISSUE. IN ADDITION, SIX ARCHAEOLOGICAL TRAVEL SEMINARS WERE CONDUCTED DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART II, LINE 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONSERVANCY RECORDS ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AND EASEMENTS AT COST IF PURCHASED OR AT FAIR VALUE AT THE DATE OF ACQUISITION IF ALL OR PART OF THE SITE WAS RECEIVED AS A DONATION. FAIR VALUE IS GENERALLY DETERMINED BY APPRAISAL AT THE TIME OF ACQUISITION AND IS NOT SUBSEQUENTLY ADJUSTED. COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH SITE OR EASEMENT PURCHASES OR DONATIONS, SUCH AS APPRAISALS, SURVEYS, AND FEES ARE CAPITALIZED AS COSTS OF THE SITE OR EASEMENT. UPON SALE OR GIFT, THE BOOK VALUE OF THE LAND, LAND INTEREST, OR EASEMENT IS REPORTED AS A PROGRAM EXPENSE AND THE RELATED PROCEEDS, IF ANY, ARE REPORTED AS REVENUE IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES. IT IS THE CONSERVANCYS INTENTION TO PRESERVE SITES AND EASEMENTS INDEFINITELY, WHICH IS GENERALLY ACCOMPLISHED BY RETAINING OWNERSHIP OF THE SITES AND EASEMENTS OR BY RESALE OR TRANSFER TO VARIOUS GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES OR PUBLIC CHARITIES. ARCHAEOLOGICAL EASEMENTS ARE COMPRISED OF LISTED RIGHTS AND/OR RESTRICTIONS OVER PROPERTIES THAT ARE CONVEYED BY A PROPERTY OWNER TO THE CONSERVANCY IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE OWNED PROPERTY AS A SIGNIFICANT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE. ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES IN PROCESS OF ACQUISITION INCLUDE AMOUNTS PAID FOR DOWN PAYMENTS, APPRAISALS, SURVEYS, AND OTHER PRE-CLOSING COSTS AS WELL AS NON-CASH DONATIONS ACCEPTED PENDING FINAL ESCROW AND TRANSFER OF TITLE. THE PROPERTIES FOR WHICH DOWN PAYMENT DEPOSITS HAVE BEEN MADE DO NOT REPRESENT PURCHASE COMMITMENTS AS THE CONSERVANCY CAN TERMINATE ALL SUCH CONTRACTS BY MERELY FORFEITING THE DEPOSIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT WAS CREATED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE GENERAL OPERATING NEEDS OF THE CONSERVANCY.

THE CONSERVANCY IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN PROVIDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE M, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 32B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONSERVANCY USES THE SERVICES OF AN INDEPENDENT APPRAISER FOR PROPERTY ACQUISITIONS.

TO ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE AMERICA'S MOST IMPORTANT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES. THE CONSERVANCY IDENTIFIES IMPORTANT ENDANGERED SITES, ACQUIRES THE PROPERTY BY PURCHASE, GIFT, OR BARGAIN SALE FROM DONORS, SECURES THE PROPERTY, STABILIZES THE CULTURAL RESOURCES AT THE SITE, MANAGES THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL PRESERVE AS PART OF A LONG-TERM PLAN, AND EDUCATES THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND LOCAL OFFICIALS ABOUT THE DESTRUCTION OF OUR CULTURAL HERITAGE AND HOW TO PRESERVE WHAT REMAINS.
BOARD MEMBERS SERVE IN A VOLUNTEER CAPACITY, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE CEO.

THE CONSERVANCY'S FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT AND THE CFO PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS. AT THE TIME IT IS FILED, A FINAL COPY IS PROVIDED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS THEN REVIEWS AND DISCUSSES THE FORM 990 AND MAKES ITS RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS, AND DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST AT THE TIME IT MAY OCCUR TO THE PRESIDENT OF THE CONSERVANCY. ALL PAYMENTS MADE DURING THE COURSE OF EACH YEAR ARE MONITORED BY THE PRESIDENT AND CFO FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THERE HAS NEVER BEEN AN ALLEGATION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SITUATION IN THE HISTORY OF THE CONSERVANCY.

COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS SET EACH YEAR BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS. A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE FIRST ASSEMBLES A LIST OF COMPENSATION DATA FROM 14 ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE FELT TO BE CLOSELY SIMILAR TO THE CONSERVANCY. THE COMPENSATION DATA IS BASED ON AVAILABLE IRS FORM 990 REPORTS AND THEN ADJUSTED FOR INFLATION AND GEOGRAPHICAL REGION. THE PRESIDENT'S ACHIEVEMENTS ARE THEN EVALUATED BY THE COMMITTEE AND A RECOMMENDATION IS MADE FOR APPROVAL BY THE FULL BOARD AS PART OF THE BUDGET PROCESS. THE CONSIDERATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED IN DETAIL IN THE MINUTES FROM THE SESSION.

COMPENSATION FOR OFFICERS OR OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IS RECOMMENDED BY THE PRESIDENT TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL JOB PERFORMANCE MEASURES, EMPLOYEE EXPERIENCE, AND PREVAILING WAGES IN THE AREA. THE SALARIES ARE APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET PROCESS.

THE CONSERVANCY'S FORM 990, AUDIT SUMMARY, AND OTHER ORGANIZATION INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE AT ITS OWN WEBSITE: WWW.ARCHAEOLOGICALCONSERVANCY.ORG. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE AT GUIDESTAR, CHARITY NAVIGATOR, THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU, AND OTHER PUBLIC WEBSITES. THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS MAY ALSO BE OBTAINED ON REQUEST AT THE CONSERVANCY HEADQUARTERS: 1717 GIRARD BLVD NE, ALBUQUERQUE, NM 87106.
